definition[0]: to become less hard or rough, or make something less hard or rough
example[0]: Use moisturizer to soften your skin.
definition[1]: if your attitude softens, or if something softens it, it becomes less strict and more sympathetic
example[2]: The government has softened its stance on public spending.
example[3]: I felt that he was beginning to soften towards me.
definition[2]: to make the effect of something seem less unpleasant or severe, or to become less unpleasant or severe
example[4]: The impact of the tax was softened by large tax-free allowances.
definition[3]: if your expression or voice softens, or if something softens it, you look or sound kinder and more gentle
example[5]: His voice softened as he spoke to her.
definition[4]: to make the shape or colour of something look less severe
example[6]: Climbing plants soften the outline of a fence.
